meanings.definition: The quality of being unable to be erased or forgotten.
meanings.sent1: The ineffaceability of the memory haunted him for years.
meanings.sent2: The ink on the paper had an ineffaceability that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The ineffaceability of the message on the whiteboard made the students chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her smile left an ineffaceability on his heart that he couldn't shake.
meanings.sent5: The ineffaceability of the graffiti on the wall made it a landmark in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The state of being indelible or permanent.
meanings.sent1: The ineffaceability of the tattoo on his arm told a story of his past.
meanings.sent2: The ineffaceability of the statue in the park made it a symbol of the town.
meanings.sent3: The ineffaceability of the stain on his shirt made him the subject of jokes.
meanings.sent4: The ineffaceability of her words echoed in his mind long after she had left.
meanings.sent5: The ineffaceability of the mountain's silhouette against the sunset was breathtaking.
